trans-unit.target: I was programmed with anti-Cerulean propaganda to play for our troops in the Staging Area -- but the Ceruleans aren’t here anymore. I’ll delete the "Crack Their Ugly Carapaces!" speech.
A neural interface means that our operators will no longer face input delays. A two-ton war machine with the reaction time of a trained assassin is awesome.

Unfortunately, the picotech nanites in the Tech Lab escaped containment and killed most of the research staff. However, they then became self-aware and tried to make up for their crimes by developing a new schematic for our communications grid. We're putting them on the payroll.
Increase Energy Production to 2,000 per hour.
Destroy command centers in a level 6 Confederates base.
Destroy the Command Center of a player 10 levels above you
Attack a Level 1 Erazi Syndicate base
The Helio Legion's perimeter is well-defended, but our analysts have located a few weaknesses. If we take them now, we can exploit their vulnerability.
Build two Reactors, or upgrade one Reactor.
Attack a Level 1 Erazi Syndicate base
This war isn't going to end anytime soon. Fuel your base accordingly.
High-throughput wormholes will allow us to land more troops in combat zones. The process can cause severe nausea, but at least it'll be enemy soil our troops throw up on.
Upgrade a Crystal Mine to Level 9.
Destroy 3 defensive towers in an attack
Destroy the Command Center of a player 5 levels above you
Increase Gas Production to 1,500 per hour
These "smart munitions" will shatter building materials but spare the riches inside. Each shot involves more calculations than a lightspeed jump to the Outer Rim.
These new Disruptor cannons can create a blast crater large enough to be seen from orbit. That's more practical -- and great fun.

Commander, a message arrived from the fleet. It states:
"Commander, today is a special day, it is the day that humans such as me reclaimed our world, and the tide turned in our war with the Ceruleans.
Now we are here, fighting to protect our homes from the Cerulean threat.
Please accept this gift, and remember to keep the faith—we are fighting for more than just glory or power."
-Admiral Tenmu
The biggest part of a Specter’s training is teaching them to become one with their rifle. With our new Scarbide Grafting technology, we can literally make that happen!
It's amazing: Cerulean chitin bonds perfectly with our more resilient alloys. Not only will our Terraknor absorb more punishment now, but they'll hit harder, too.
Commander, many other ex-Union officers are banding together for mutual protection. It is time to find others who share our goals, and join an Alliance.
Feathered tritanium plates will allow Shrikes to take a beating like never before. Even if a section shears away, the surrounding panels cover the gap.

With this new, exciting material, our researchers have used the Scarbide to add another layer of armor to our Titans.
Do you ever get the feeling that some days our researchers are just phoning it in?

Crystal and gas are vital for upgrading your base and defenses. The more you collect, the more you can build.

Click any resource building and select COLLECT ALL.
Increase Uranium Production to 3000 per hour.
The Cerulean atmosphere plays havoc with weapons. We can counteract the effect. It's times like this I'm glad I don't breathe.
Commander, we require additional funds and materials. Our lab techs are discovering new elements so rapidly, they have to update the periodic table in realtime.
Increase Energy Production to 24,000 per hour.
Increase Uranium Production to 1,500 per hour
Build two Solar Plants, or upgrade one Solar Plant.

Admiral Tenmu is hoping you can support him by giving him #GASDONATION# Gas.
TIP: This is a one-time donation and the mission is only claimable if you have banked enough Gas.
A poorly trained Bomba is an ineffective Bomba. If you want these beasts to make a big impact on our enemies, make sure you're sending them out prepared.

We’re going to try using Scarbide metal to reinforce the Rhinos’ horns. It couldn’t hurt, right?
Actually, it will probably hurt them a lot. Good thing they’re expendable.

My database indicates that an additional Barracks means each soldier has more personal space, which can reduce the incidence of personnel "bugging out" and "blowing the commanding officer's head off." I hope you appreciate this information.

The new Pulse Tank variant features high-grade explosive rounds. Though not technically an upgrade, it's worth noting that we've taken the liberty of decorating each warhead with expletives in the languages of our enemies.
Increase Uranium Production to 24,000 per hour.
You can only train as many troops as you can house, Commander.
Upgrade a Staging Area to Level 9
At this rate, your great-grandchildren will still be digging for crystals. Upgrade or expand!
Attack another player and destroy a building
These new facilities will allow us to turn even sleep into a form of intense training. Our fresh troops will perform like seasoned veterans.
Increase Energy Production to 1,500 per hour
One Disruptor can take out a target in a single shot. 10 Disruptors – you see where this is going...
Dish out more than 100,000 points of damage in an attack against another player
The Concussion Turret freezes both damages and immobilizes its target.

Please build another staging area so we have room for more Raiders and other soldiers.

Click BUILD.
Select the COMBAT tab.
Select the STAGING AREA.
Click BUILD.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 10 Legion base.
Attack a player 20 levels below you
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 20 Syndicate base.
Grod used the spoils of war to build a lavish emergency bunker. He can run the entire Helio military operation from a control room inside. Up for a "black ops" mission, commander?
Thanks to Cerulean alloys and production lines, techniques like riveting and welding are becoming obsolete. We can construct anything via organic molds -- even the Factory itself.

We have found a way to improve deadliness of our Pyros by making their own bodies combustible! It lowers their life expectancy to a matter of days, but let?s be frank: you kind of like watching them burn.
Rolling thunder! That’s the sweet rumbling of a fully upgraded Disruptor.
Dance music? No, those are subsonic vibropulses. We're using them to accelerate the crystal mining process. Admittedly, it's got a pretty good beat, until your eardrums burst.
Like Thermopylae, but with more winning
After the Galactic Union dissolved, the Erazi went back to their old ways - attacking the bases that won't pay them. Soon, they'll look in our direction.
Loot over 5,000 gas from any faction's base
What's that on your forehead? Oh, I see... but not as well as you. My, what a great place for a third eye!
Shorten Building, Research, or Training time by 15 hours.
We could use more AIs around here. Build a Factory, and I'll show you how to make more friends.
Our ace Disruptor operators are pushing and shoving for a chance to get inside a Pulse Tank cockpit. It would cut down on fistfights if we could build a few more of them.
I'm told that "Beast Mode" is triggered by the destruction of an allied unit. Which would be heartwarming, if the results weren't so terrifying.
Increase Energy Production to 6,000 per hour.
Commander, using a Cerulean Core we can upgrade my circuitry exponentially! This may provide me with the ability to subtly control your thoughts, but that’s a risk you’re willing to take!
The Erazi Cell Field contains vast numbers of Solar Plants. I don't know how they use that energy, but I do know what to research if you take it.
Much like General Grod, Legion bases are big, ugly, and hard to destroy. This one will be a brutal challenge, but the rewards will be sweet indeed.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 30 Legion base.
The Syndicate’s arms trade put a lot of weapons in circulation. Time to return some artillery!
Shorten Building, Research, Warp Gate or Training time by 1 minute.
Hidden Cerulean code within the Control Devices has shown our lab how to synthesize an "attack pheromone." We can spray it on priority targets and watch the carnage unfold.
The Specter's have taken a keen interest in this turret. Make a few improvements and you can count on a few of them to join your ranks.

The loons in the Tech Lab have gone completely mad. One says that they're the Morlocks and you're the leader of the Eloi. Another is sharpening a stick, and says that you're Piggy, and sucks to your ass-mar. I believe this has something to do with the research into non-Euclidian geometry they've been conducting. Whatever the case, just remain here for the next couple of hours.
Upgrade an X-1 Cannon to level 6
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 1 Confederate base.
Increase Gas Production to 700 per hour

Gas production is up 500%, in no small part due to the fact that we accidentally drilled into a gas pocket so heavily pressurized that our workers had no choice but to extract it all in a matter of minutes or we'd all be blown to smithereens. I didn't mention it before because I didn't want to alarm you.
Push your Marines to be their best, and you’ll have the most elite warriors in the galaxy.
I trust you received the Tech Lab memo: "We're Making Gravity Rifles Suck Even Harder!". They're scientists, not PR people.

Roughly 70% of this planet's natural gas was believed to be 'unrecoverable.' However, with geothermal detonators, we can drop that number. Of course, it's possible that we'll trigger a tectonic plate shift in the process. So there's that.
We've intercepted disturbing chatter about a Confederacy alliance with the Legion. We need to cripple Malick before he can make any deals.
A squad of Raiders can empty an enemy's resources quicker than you can harvest your own.
The Maar Confederacy has a network of special operatives. They even told us how to train them! Well, not really "told". I stole the documents from their servers.
Using the same micro-turbine technology that helps Raider jet packs, we have been able to use Scarbide metal to improve the delivery system for the Hornets’ “stingers”.

The new compression algorithms will facilitate a significant increase in energy storage capacity, which will in turn clear space for other resources. The odds of space/time shearing are incredibly low. I say we go for it.
Marines were the backbone of Galactic Union forces in the war against the Ceruleans. The Ceruleans are gone, but Marines still fight.
Destroy the Command Center of a player 10 levels above you
Increase Uranium Production to 80,000 per hour.
Pulse Tanks absorb reactor energy from destroyed structures and use it to transform, gaining 50% more damage and a wide-area attack that disables turrets.
One Shrike is terrifying enough. Ten Shrikes and you've assembled a squad of flying guillotines.
We can add a bio-warfare element to our X-1 missile turrets, increasing damage at the cost of lowered galactic opinion. As an A.I., I can live with that.
Destroy the Command Center in a Confederate base.

Admiral Tenmu is hoping you can support him by giving him #AMOUNT# Crystal.
TIP: This is a one-time donation and the mission is only claimable if you have banked enough Crystal.
Enemy gun emplacements are about to get a lot less intimidating, Commander. Titans shrug off Concussion Turret rounds and keep moving.
When it comes to warfare on Cerulea IV, the size of your army can certainly make a difference. Overwhelming the enemy should not be ruled out as a condition for victory.

Gas is used as fuel and for building.

Click BUILD.
Select RESOURCES.
Click the GAS REFINERY.
Click BUILD.

Your warp gate level determines how many troops you can send into battle at one time. If we really want to dominate, I suggest we upgrade it immediately.

Select your WARP GATE.
Click UPGRADE.
Click UPGRADE again.
Now that our Raiders are hauling an asteroid's worth of uranium on each trip, we should upgrade their lift jets.

The troop capacity has been increased significantly, Commander. Your enemies will be obliterated by the legion that you've assembled. Just remember: with great power comes great opportunity for carnage without mercy.

Defending your base is important, Commander. Build more gun turrets and place them strategically to protect your base from enemy factions.

Click BUILD.
Select the DEFENSE tab.
Select the GUN TURRET.
Click BUILD.
It'll take over 20 tons of tungsten carbide to refit our Titan armor. We could trade that same amount of metal for a small moon.
Make sure your Silos are upgraded. You will be getting a lot of resources...
The Erazi are secretly funding an elite military expedition into some ruins. It must be related to the Cerulean disappearence. Whatever they find, it's better off in our hands.
We've unlocked the secret to Cerulean manufacturing automatons. As an A.I., I'm outraged at how many of our own robots this will put out of work.
Insectoid noises aren't random; it turns out there's a rhyme and reason to their screeches. We can use this to our advantage, but you might want to invest in some earplugs.

While we couldn't use the Cerulean Core to directly upgrade the factory, we ground it up and added it the sentient Factory Workers’ coffee.
Now they work 15 hour shifts! I foresee no negative consequences for this! None at all.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 350 Confederate base.
Free sunlight spilling everywhere, and all it's doing is keeping this desert parched.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 1000 Syndicate base.
Upgrade Your Sniper Turret to level 9
Increase Gas production by +300% for 24 hours.
Increase Energy Production to 700 per hour
Increase Crystal Production to 700 per hour
Upgrade a Fusion Reactor to Level 8.
Build more Reactors, and upgrade them.

The Helio Legion produces enough Uranium to train enormous, bloodthirsty armies.

Click the Combat icon at the bottom of the screen.
Select FACTIONS.
SCOUT a Level 3 HELIO base.
ATTACK the base.

If we have any Rhinos in our army, send them into battle with our marines!
Our X-1 missiles could use more bang, and our scientists want to try a new explosive compound. Maybe move the turrets to a remote corner of the base before you give the go-ahead.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 2000 Legion base.
Increase Uranium production by +300% for 7 days.

Commander, by triggering sunspot activity, and redirecting it here with anaclastic satellite arrays, we can boost our energy production. Of course, we might also burn ourselves like ants under a magnifying glass. Malick would do it.
One of the scientists at the Tech Lab just asked me "Why melt steel alloy when you could vaporize it?" We should reward this sort of thinking, Commander.
Bomba units continue to prove their effectiveness in battle. We should keep pushing to improve their impact in the field.

While we couldn’t think of a way to upgrade the Lancers themselves, we managed to make long, pointy sticks out of Scarbide to jab the Lancers while they’re in their cages. This enrages them, enhancing their combat performance. Simple. Effective.

We've found out what makes the Helio warriors so ferocious. They welcome death in battle, believing in a place of reward after death. While I don?t suggest letting the soldiers believe such silly things, we can artificially simulate this ferocity.
Augmenting the Hornet's propulsion system and reverse thrusters will improve its maneuverability. Extending the range of its cannons will improve its lethality. I say we do both.
We've programmed these crystal-harvesting nanites not to replicate more than necessary, so there's virtually no chance that they'll overrun our Command Center.
Gun Turrets melt at 5168 degrees. Pyro plasma heats a target to 10,000 degrees. I'm sure you don't need an A.I. to do that math.
Upgrade a Staging Area to Level 10
Marines were the backbone of Galactic Union forces in the war against the Ceruleans. The Ceruleans are gone, but Marines still fight.
Specter technology lets you strike from a distance, firing from behind heavily armored infantry.
A fully upgraded Tesla Turret can strike 6 enemy units at once!
Increase Energy Production to 150,000 per hour.
Upgrade a Staging Area to Level 8

Solar energy is used for research and some buildings.

Click BUILD.
Select RESOURCES.
Click the SOLAR PLANT.
Click BUILD.
Plan your revenge! Use the MAP to find the Maar Level 1 base, and SCOUT their forces.
The heavy armor and high-caliber cannons we used to mount on ground vehicles will now be usable on our air units. Progress is a wonderful thing, Commander.
We're close to discovering a way to keep troops on high alert indefinitely, no sleep or food required. Even better, the process doesn't violate galactic rights laws. Technically.

One of our Researchers postulated that by using Scarbide Alloys in the barrel, we could shoot Bombas out of the Disrupter Cannons. While the experiment was unsuccessful, we were able to increase the shell’s payload.
That researcher had a LOT of cleanup to do.

The clathrate deposits we've discovered within the planet's mantle will increase our gas production, but there may be some minor annoying incovenient side effects like respiratory failure and death. Just wanted to let you know.
We've unlocked new self-repair automations that can repair any issues with the manufacture machinery almost instantly. After centuries of trying to avoid machinery breaking down, this seems easier.
You can recruit Z'ratarian Rhinos by proving you can manufacture their specialized power armor.
These new Pulse Tank engines draw energy from a quantum singularity. Just *one* could power an entire industrial society. I guess we'll save applications like that for peacetime.
This is my rifle, this is my arm
Commander, we have enhanced our pulse tanks with shells that are actually low-yield atomic weapons. There are some inherent risks, but what?s a little radiation poisoning between friends?
The Shrike is like a viper – fast, furious, and full of venom.
Greater Warp Gate technology is now available for the Aurora-1 Colony. I suggest you take this time to upgrade and maximize our efficiency
The Maar Confederacy base "Lattice Core" is the largest Crystal storage site on Cerulea IV. Let's take what we can, and blast the rest into drifts of glittery dust.
You have one Turret – great! But, what if there's more than one attacker?
Use your Tech Lab to research improvements to your Marines.
Build more Gas Refineries, and upgrade them.

The Maar Confederacy thinks they own this planet. Please teach them a lesson!

Click the Combat icon at the bottom of the screen.
Select FACTIONS.
SCOUT a Level 3 Maar base.
ATTACK the base.

I recommend sending ALL of our marines into battle, Commander!
Upgrade a Solar Plant to Level 9.
Improved optics on our Tesla Towers will let them track more enemy units. And kill them.

The heap leach method isn't just fun to say -- it's also fun to do. By spraying acid over piles of radioactive ore, we can increase our production significantly, and we can ensure that anyone who seizes this area from us acquires a territory soaked with radioactive acid.
In order to offset the cost of this Disruptor upgrade, we had to cancel all medical services, but I'm sure the troops understand.
This upgrade will augment the Disruptor's sensory array, and we've also made some adjustments to the cannon's bore. All told, it's a sleeker, stronger killing machine.
Destroy the Command Center of a player 10 levels above you
Our Rhino units requested stronger shoulder armor, Commander. If you deny them, I suggest not delivering the news in person. Send your least favorite aide.
Our latest round of Disrupter upgrades came from picking through the wreckage from the Maar Confederacy's latest attack. For an evil overlord, Mallick kind of sucks at his job.
Increase Crystal Production to 1,500 per hour.
Barracks train infantry units that you can use to attack other faction and player bases.
Fund this project and every one of our Pyro flame projectors will be powered by a small-scale hot fusion reaction.There are a few negligible risks... Forget I mentioned it, it's nothing.
Destroy Command Centers in Level 6 Legion bases.
One of Malick's most trusted lieutenants is in charge of operations at this base. Leveling the Command Center and neutralizing all hostiles on the ground will give Malick something to seethe about.

We tried to use Scarbide as part of a liquid material we can add to the outside of our Shrikes to improve aerodynamics.
It did no such thing, but it did paint them red, so that’s something.
The more energy you leech, the more vulnerable you leave your enemy.

A second barracks lets you queue up two different troop types to build.

Click BUILD.
Select the COMBAT tab.
Select the BARRACKS.
Click BUILD.
Supply Depots increase storage capacity for all resources. Upgrade them for greater storage.
Check in with Kira once a day.
This upgrade makes perfect sense. A few minor tweaks and the result is nearly 20% more firepower.
Don't be alarmed if it gets dark when this plant is upgraded. The new panels actually bend light around themselves. Kind of ironic, actually.

This time, we've upgraded by adding a snack bar, dance floor, and valet parking. Just kidding. A little Cerulean humor. We actually revamped the HVAC and rerouted some sewer lines. Then we installed some additional insulation. Nothing spectacular about this one.
Marines have a soft spot for Titans - they look at them like big brothers. Titans don't have a soft spot for Marines. They don't have soft spots, period.
Facing your column of Disruptors, your enemies will feel like Tyralian desert-flukes in a puddle of myctalnic condensate. You know what I mean?
Dispersing nanoclouds throughout the atmosphere has intensified the sun's rays, resulting in a higher output of solar energy... And possibly no rain for the next seven years.
Commander, I believe we can further increase the physical capabilities of our Rhino troops by splicing in DNA from a centuries-extinct Earth creature called? Oh, so THAT?S where their name came from!
Upgrade Your Sniper Turret to level 8
The Maar never dreamed we'd be strong enough to attack the seat of their power. Let's give Malick's propaganda department something ugly to cover up.
Sure, any shambling mutant can crack a Supply Depot if you hand him a gravity blaster, but not everyone is born with the proper looting mentality.

The Rhinos' aggression levels have dropped, so we've persuaded them that enemy troops have begun to question their masculinity. You may want to observe the ensuing carnage on your vid-screen, Commander.
We've developed a new guidance system for Shrike ordnance; it minimizes human error and can even predict enemy movements. No luck with weather forecasts, though.
Shrike gangs are intimidating, especially when they're slicing through air at top speeds.
Rival Commanders are racing to build their own colony bases. Upgrade the warp gate so we can overwhelm them with force and tear down those command centers in one shot!
The Tech Lab just sent an upgrade proposal. I didn't know that "Horn Sharpening" was a field of research.
Our networks have gathered intel about a dangerous new technology that the Maar are pursuing. Something that will change the war forever. We need more information.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 6 Helio Legion base.
Loot over 5,000 crystals from any faction's base
Cerulean Controls Devices have two important functions: a resonance beacon to attract the creature, and a simple control element to subdue them.
Many strategists have said that if there was a way to chemically induce and control Z'ratari battle-rage, they would be unstoppable in combat. Well, guess what?

If we can just recalibrate the length of those aggregated diamond nanorods, we can multiply our energy production significantly. But that entails risking incineration on the superheated solar panels. My calculations suggest it is worth the risk.
Why waste ammo on enemies when you can stampede them?
Having the most devastating units on Cerulea will not only secure you a place on the Territorial Map, but also in history.
Personality analysis shows that these candidates are committing robberies anyway. They might as well do it for us.
Upgrade a Staging Area to Level 7
Successful operation on Cerulea IV starts with a well-equipped Command Center. Well, actually, it starts with a brilliant Support A.I., but you already have that.
Our scientists make things lighter and smaller. Those won't improve a Z'ratari Rhino.
Cerulean crystal is resilient, which makes it an ideal building material. Turn the entire crust of this planet into one big quarry.

Supply Depots hold a large amount of resources.

Click BUILD.
Select RESOURCES.
Click the SUPPLY DEPOT.
Click BUILD.
Increase Gas Production to 50,000 per hour.
Increase Energy Production to 50,000 per hour.
What's better than ripping open a supply cache with gravity blasts? Ripping it open with metal-eating nanomachine munitions. The Ceruleans had cool toys.
The Colony Warp Gate barely survived the latest Maar invasion against Aurora-1. Invest the time in an upgrade and save on the repair costs in the case of another attack.
Check in with Kira once a day.
Commander, I've tracked rumors that the Maar have partially completed the Cerulean research started by the Union. We need to attack their research base and get it for ourselves.
Upgrade a Supply Depot to Level 8
Our mines have reached unprecedented production levels. The crystal dust will probably penetrate the miners' breathing-filters, but you can't make an omelet without breaking a few lungs.
Whether it's a prison, a schoolyard, or a planet torn apart by civil war, there's always someone waiting to pounce on those appearing weaker. Find that someone, and take him down a few notches.
Admittedly, the Syndicate's notched up a few victories against us lately. But revenge is a dish best served by a mech division.
Moving targets are hard to wallop. Solve that problem by stunning enemies with a Concussion Turret.
My psych files indicate that soldiers who watch comrades fall in battle often wish that they too had been taken. As always, technology provides a solution.
Specter File 4 can only be accessed with thumbprint, retina, and breath scans. In unfortunate related news, I don't have thumbs, eyes, or breath.
The structural upgrades to the Barracks will enable the building to withstand more damage. The enemy will waste their ammo, and then our soldiers will waste the enemy. Nice.
2x the speed of all Training for 1 hour.
It’s not just the factions. Countless renegades splintered from the Union as well. Be prepared!
Attack a Level 3 Helio Legion base

By replacing foampad mattresses with vertical cryostasis tubes, we can fit the soldiers into a small area in the center of the bunker. This permits us to reinforce the walls with additional osmium plating, resulting in a more secure building. And no more sleepwalking.
Fully upgrade your Pyros, and enemies will be diagnosed with inflammatory base syndrome.
Cerulean computers leave ours in the cyber-dust, and we can use the processors we've salvaged to aid in our research. Fifty septillion operations per second? I feel old.
This tank is the single most powerful machine you can manufacture. What are you waiting for?
Steal an enemy’s uranium to make your own ammo, then shoot them with it? I like the way you think!
Inflict more than 5,000 points of damage in an attack
Attack a player 20 levels below you
Every day KIRA sends out drones to search for Salvage Boxes left behind on the battlefield. When she finds them she will hand them over to you.
It's time to increase storage capacity once more. Currently, our supplies are jammed in there pretty tight. If a depot gets hit, we're in for some gorgeous fireworks.
We're not just celebrating the construction of a new factory; we're also happy to announce that there hasn't been an industrial accident in over sixteen minutes.
At this rate, your great-grandchildren will still be digging for crystals. Upgrade or expand!
We have the option of upgrading Titan weapons with reactive Cerulium. It's a good idea, and not just because explosions excite me.

The new liquid core has improved the reactor's efficiency, and we've been spraying the leftover dregs of molten uranium in the garden, just to see what the results are. I mean, what's the worst that could happen?
It seems Ceruleans were able to detect crystal deposits by measuring reactions to sonic pulses. Very useful, provided you don't mind the entire compound shaking every hour or so.
Loot over 1,000 gas from any faction's base.
We have upgraded base telemetry by using the circuitry of a crashed Erazi Frigate. All we need are some thrusters and the Command Center can be repurposed into a starship.
Executrix Scylith and her faction have been reported to making significant progress with their quantum genetic experiments. Defeat one of their bases and we might just learn what these are for.
With Cerulean warp scanners we can finally deploy larger and tighter troop formations without worrying that one soldier might materialize inside another.
Back on Earth, hornets' stings were more painful than bees, and they could sting multiple times. Of course, they're all gone now, but their namesakes are also good at inflicting large-scale pain.
Scylith's techs are working on some new weapon culled from a raid on one of Malick's bases. She's only got one piece of the puzzle, but we can't let her figure it out before we do.
Complete this upgrade and the turret will be dishing out over 300% more damage than when you first built it. A wise investment, to say the least.
I've decrypted the files we recovered from that Erazi Council meeting. They detail an assassination plot, and you're on the target list. Let's beat their hit squad to the punch.
Loot over 1,000 energy from any faction's base
At this rate, your great-grandchildren will still be digging for crystals. Upgrade or expand!
Destroy 10 turrets in a Maar Confederate's base
Surplus resources are useless unless they're stored properly. Crystals lose integrity, gas evaporates, energy dissipates, and uranium has a half-life. I recommend building a Supply Depot.
Build more Solar Plants, and upgrade them.
Upgrade a Supply Depot to Level 9
Upgrade Colony Warp Gate to Level 2
Remember, their attack slow the enemy's rate of fire. Use the Hornets in large numbers, and you can overrun enemy defenses while they're still scrambling to mount a counterattack.
Upgrade a Gas Refinery to Level 8.
Concussion turrets fire shockwave rounds that slow attackers to a crawl, on the rare occasions that they are not pulverized outright. I quoted that from the USI operations manual.
This building will keep our troops plugged into VR modules instead of sleeping, eating or taking breaks. This will keep them sharp and obedient.
I am currently devoting only 0.0001% of my memory to our scientific discoveries. This is because we have not made any. There’s a world of exploitable Cerulean technology out there.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 15 Syndicate base.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 25 Syndicate base.
Build more Crystal Mines, and upgrade them.
Jump jets help our soldiers move and fight. Improvements will mean fewer overload accidents, which the Marines call "blast-offs".
Upgrade Your Sniper Turret to level 7
Increase Crystal Production to 3,000 per hour.
Cerulium walls are ultra-dense and near-impenetrable. Our troops will not only survive the impact of Disruptor fire, they'll sleep through it.
Inflict more than 5,000 points of damage in an attack
Loot over 1,000 crystals from any faction's base
Stir up trouble for your enemies by mobilizing an entire nest of hell-bent Hornets.
Upgrade a Gun Turret to Level 2

A breakthrough! Control Devices can be used for complex telepathic communication between lifeforms and their "owners". Combat control will now be close to perfect.
Well, as close as it gets when linking to a giant wasp...
Loot over 5,000 crystals from any faction's base
Malick will be back again if we can't stop the flow of Confederate soldiers and supplies onto Cerulea. With our recent attacks, the last Maar orbital drop site is vulnerable.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 20 Legion base.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 500 Syndicate base.

Let's train some Raiders to use in our next battle.

Select your BARRACKS.
Click TRAIN.
Select the RAIDER.
Enter '5' and click TRAIN.
Destroy the command center of a level 350 Erazi base
Your enemy needs uranium to make weapons, making uranium theft a new form of nuclear disarmament.

The upgraded assembly mechanism will enable us to produce even more armor and weaponry per day, Commander. The factory has also been re-armored, which will allow it to withstand our enemies while our turrets incinerate them.
Enemy gun emplacements are about to get a lot less intimidating, Commander. Titans shrug off Concussion Turret rounds and keep moving.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 10 Confederate base.
Our mines have reached unprecedented production levels. The crystal dust will probably penetrate the miners' breathing-filters, but you can't make an omelet without breaking a few lungs.

General Grod of the Helio Legion betrayed the Union to please his massive army.

We're strong enough to contain him, but we should train while we fight to keep our numbers high.
Increase Gas Production to 2,000 per hour.

We've gone green with this upgrade, making an effort to reduce the energy needs of the Command Center while focusing on renewable sources like wind and sunlight. Just because we've rendered most of this planet uninhabitable doesn't mean we don't care about the environment.
Your enemies hardly look like environmentalists, so who are they kidding with those solar panels?
Increase Uranium Production to 50,000 per hour.
Your enemy will need all that gas to rebuild after your attack. Don't leave them a single drop!
Upgrade a Supply Depot to Level 10
With advances in lightweight Scarbide alloys, we created more room inside the Pulse Tank. Then we shoved a Rhino in there! He doesn't know how to drive, but the rest of the crew finds him…motivating.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 500 Legion base.
General Grod's mech units are preparing for a "terminal interdiction," meaning that they intend to scour this area of all life. If we hit them while they're preparing the invasion, we stand a chance.
With a [RESEARCH OBJECT X], it will be possible to modify Titan armor to project an inertial dampening bubble. It is easy to shrug off bullets that barely move.
Marines love going into battle behind a Rhino squad - less visibility but longer life span.
Loot over 5,000 energy from any faction's base

Building a barracks will allow you to train troops and engage in battles.

Click BUILD.
Select the COMBAT tab.
Select the BARRACKS.
Click BUILD.
Resources aren't going to harvest themselves. Time to employ a little industrial ingenuity.
The Bomba is a savage fighter by nature-- capable of tearing enemies to shreds. If we could spend the time to hone this raw power, the advantages could be worth the effort.
Defeat an Erazi base of level #AMOUNT# or higher.
Grod's military network is built around a series of "power clusters," including this base of operations. Destroy it, and you deal the Legion a crippling blow.
Cerulea's sun has unique features we haven't been compensating for. Our Solar Plants will be more efficient with a few changes. Also, bad news about that sunblock we've been issuing...
I powered down for maintenence last night with 9,764,200 top secret files in my database. When I powered back up, the number was 9,764,201.

Close counts with horseshoes, hand grenades, and – most devastating of all – the X-1 Cannon. This miracle of military-industrial might spits explosive shells that damage anyone and everyone in the blast radius.

The staging area upgrades are nearly finished. I just need you to sign off on this crazy little idea we had: spatial-distortion implants. The troops are all wedged in there, but if we rewire their brains, we can convince them there's plenty of room. Not sure how it'll affect combat performance, but either way, it'l be interesting, right?
Increase Crystal production by +300% for 24 hours.
Reactors process Uranium for weapons and advanced parts.

Uranium-powered weapons and vehicles are the might of our army!

Click BUILD.
Select RESOURCES.
Click the REACTOR.
Click BUILD.

Turns out that letting soldiers sleep where they want was a terrible idea. Some of them apparently "crashed" on a Shrike's wings, which then launched, got shot down, and crashed. Long story short, we need a place for them to sleep. I suggest a Barracks.
These crystals took millennia to form, and it's taking you almost as long to excavate them. Alright, maybe that's an exaggeration. But you could pick up the pace by upgrading your mines.
Upgrade a Crystal Mine to Level 10.
The Helio are training new troops right here on Cerulea IV. Say the word, Commander, and we'll turn their daily marching drills into an exciting live-fire exercise.
Attack a player 5 levels below you

The upgraded barracks can now withstand a direct bombardment from an X-1 Cannon. We confirmed this after several tests. Unfortunately, the first few tests were failures, and there were casualties, so we'll be observing four seconds of silence now... Okay, back to work.
Pick off your enemy’s defenses and they’ll be left picking up the charred and broken pieces.
Increase Gas Production to 700 per hour
Pulse Tanks are notoriously hard to destroy, but the new tachyon shields will make it even harder.
Executrix Scylith's neural spiders have managed to extract a great deal of information from our cortical network. We need to wreck her Command Center before those files are sold to other enemies.
Further Specter training documents are in an encrypted Confederate file with no key. No problem. With a proper Tech Lab, I can crack it.

Admiral Tenmu is hoping you can support him by giving him #AMOUNT# Gas.
TIP: This is a one-time donation and the mission is only claimable if you have banked enough Gas.
Our Pyro units are being held back by safety measures in their suits. Yes, it's inhuman to suggest removing them. That's why I'm here.
We will enhance Raider gravity guns with an A.I. to separate plunder from junk. I am not jealous at all. Really.

Select your BARRACKS.
Click TRAIN.
Select the MARINE.
Enter '10' and click TRAIN.
We're about to become a tempting target for space pirates, Commander. With this new technology, one of our supply buildings will house enough raw resources to finance a large-scale war.
Your enemy won't believe how much you just cost them.
The new Marine rifles will fire rounds at such high velocity, they'll need new combat suits to withstand the recoil. Our scientists are going to be busy.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 500 Confederate base.
Optimize your Titans to their full potential and you’ve created a squadron of walking tanks.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 40 Confederate base.
[X OBJECT] engine technology is the key to Shrike performance. Greater mobility keeps units alive longer, and higher attack speed adds punch to their cannons.
Commander, the nets tell me that Executrix Scylith has contracted an elite mercenary company to hit us. I've found their camp, and we have a chance to hit them first.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 30 Syndicate base.
I've seen tougher bipeds peddling girl scout cookies. Shape 'em up or ship 'em out!
There's nothing worse than being in the middle of nowhere and running out of gas.
Commander, this new building will allow us to store even more resources, with improved armor and structural integrity.
Enemies conduct electricity, meaning a fully upgraded Tesla Tower can strike 6 enemies at once!
Upgrade a Concussion Turret to level 5

Admiral Tenmu is hoping you can support him by giving him #AMOUNT# Energy.
TIP: This is a one-time donation and the mission is only claimable if you have banked enough Energy.

The X-1 Cannon will deliver splash damage to a wide area of troops.

Select the X-1 CANNON.
Make sure your Silos are upgraded. You will be getting a lot of resources...

Malick's never going to forgive you for humiliating him on the field of war. Given a chance, he'd rather die in an apocalyptic battle than surrender. He'll take the whole planet with him if he has to. He must be stopped, Commander.
We're on the verge of a breakthrough in infantry tactics and equipment, Commander. Show me a [RESEARCH OBJECT X] and I'll show you the deadliest company this side of the Crab Nebula.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 30 Confederate base.
Loot over 1,000 gas from any faction's base.
Increase Crystal Production to 24,000 per hour.
The harsh rays of the sun bombard this planet constantly. Bad news for susceptible workers. Good news for our solar-radiation harvesting operation.
Shorten Building, Research, Warp Gate or Training time by 1 hour.
Upgrade Your Sniper Turret to level 5
Shorten Building, Research, or Training time by 8 hours.
By combining Cerulean extractor scarabs with our own technology, we can develop nanomachines that will seek out and destroy impurities at a molecular level.
Using Scarbide infusions, we've finally found a way to improve the longevity of our Pyro troops! With these involuntary, painful infusions, it will take 18% longer for a Pyro to burn to death.

The venom we've extracted from the stingers of the Lancer is highly necrotic; by synthesizing it and incorporating the byproduct into their weapons systems, we've successfully merged nature with mad science. Such a nice feeling.
Recover what they've taken from you!
Build more Gas Refineries, and upgrade them.
Use your Barracks to train a squad of Marines.
The Stinger is kinda lame, currently.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 250 Legion base.
We have discovered new, flammable resources on this planet. Let's use them to set our enemies on fire!
Increase Gas Production to 150,000 per hour.
To ensure the secrets within these [BUILD OBJECT X]s aren't leaked, we'll install security measures that vaporize any unauthorized personnel. Please don't forget your keycard, Commander.
Don’t hold back! Put a serious hurt and your enemy, and they’ll think twice about revenge.
A few minutes' worth of adjustments and a barrel or two of uranium and we can squeeze some additional firepower out of these turrets.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 3 Helio Legion base
Increase Uranium production by +300% for 24 hours.
Help these Raiders reach their full potential and it’ll be you who plunders maximum booty.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 150 Legion base.
A single Pyro deals more damage than any other unit. 10 of them together can raze an entire base.
Clean out their depots now, and they won’t have the resources to rebuild before a second attack.
The new Lancer upgrades will transform a naturally dangerous predator into a fighting machine worthy of your leadership, Commander. However, don't expect so much as a "thank you" from those ingrates.
Attack a player 10 levels below you
Destroy the Command Center of a player 10 levels above you
Did I say Pyro plasma heats its target to 10,000 degrees? We can push it to 12,000.
Attack a player who has attacked your base
There's plenty of Sun to go around - don't be shy!
Increase Crystal Production to 80,000 per hour.
Gun Turrets provide long range defensive power. Build another to improve your defenses.
Weapons rely on uranium. The more robust your enrichment program, the more of a threat you pose.
Scorched Cerulea might sound like a crayon, but it's the color you'll paint enemy territory with Pyro technology.
Increase Crystal Production to 700 per hour.
Upgrade a Crystal Mine to Level 8.
Inflict more than 5,000 points of damage in an attack
The A.I. used by the Maar has no personality at all - it can't even tell a joke. Destroy their Command Center, and you’ll knock it offline before it bores anyone to death.
We've figured out how to redirect coronal mass ejections towards Cerulea IV, which will make our solar plants more effective. However, bad news about that sunblock we've been using...
If this research pans out, our operators will be able to plant a single nanomachine in the ground, take a nap, and wake up inside a newly-built tank.
Raider rifles use gravity to tear down buildings and suck up enemy goods. More g-force equals more loot!
Marines are a "humans only" outfit who love to be first into combat. This matches my files on human bravery and human stupidity.

The sagalium rods in the warp gate were corroding, and most of the wiring was pretty much shot. Which explains why we inadvertently sent a few Shrikes into the center of the sun last week. All better now.
The only object that can withstand the heat of this new Solar Plasma is the canister holding it. Even that isn't a sure thing.
Accept "token of goodwill" from enemy commander

The Helio Legion produces enough Uranium to train enormous, bloodthirsty armies.

Click the Combat icon at the bottom of the screen.
Select FACTIONS.
SCOUT a Level 3 HELIO base.
ATTACK the base.

If we have any Rhinos in our army, send them into battle with our marines!
This isn't your grandfather's virtual reality training, Commander. We'll build simulators so lifelike, they'll cause PTSD! Which I concede is a shortcoming of the program.
Keep your friends close and keep your enemies from getting stronger.
Defeat a Helio base of level #AMOUNT# or higher.

This upgrade was made possible by a technological breakthrough that, regrettably, relies on a mineral found only in the bones of an endangered species. But I promise you that they will live forever through the miracle of taxidermy.
Loot over 5,000 gas from any faction's base
We've found a new material on Cerulea IV that defies all metallurgy. It could be an important scientific discovery. We're going to weaponize it as soon as we can.
Build more Crystal Mines, and upgrade them.
We've found a way to improve Titan armor. Don't ask how much it costs. Just trust me and sign the order. You’ll be glad you did.

A little genetic research will make our marines more deadly in battle.

Click your TECH LAB.
Select MARINE.
Click RESEARCH.
Gives you 7 days of protection. Removed if you attack another player.
These new Hornet munitions will stick to what they are fired at, emitting a low level EMP wave and injecting various viruses into the circuitry of the machine.
Titans are heavy armor suits designed to take punishment. I call them "FILE X37-C". The Marines call them "walking tanks".
To prepare, have units in your Staging Area. Use the Map, select Legion Level 1, Scout that base, then Attack!
Gather a mighty hoard! This mission idea came from Katiyana, the winner of our June 2011 Mission Contest!
I have good news, Commander. The extended, base-wide power failure we experienced wasn't Erazi sabotage. It was a successful weapons test. *Very* successful.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 1000 Confederate base.
We've optimized the tritanium plates on the Hornet's undercarriage, and we've managed to increase the weapons payload.
The Maar Codex (Article 34a, Section 113) requires that Maar soldiers receive permission for each munition fired. Conclusion: They respond slowly to ambushes.
Commander, we?ve found a new regimen to improve the reaction time of our Shrike Pilots. It mostly involves video games from Earth?s late 20th century, but whatever works, right?
Upgrade Your Sniper Turret to level 3
Increase Uranium Production to 700 per hour
Our engineers have designed a tungsten bunker shell to wrap around your office, so you can survive bombardment. Be flattered! They wouldn't have bothered unless they liked you.
Through the effort of our scientists, the strength of the Bomba has improved greatly. However, additional improvements could be made.

I took a personal tour of the barracks this morning. In addition to the standard wolf-whistles and marriage proposals, I gathered quite a bit of information about structural deficiencies we can remedy during our next upgrade.
Now, our Marines recognize only two things - the enemy, and authority. I'm closer to human than they are. The irony isn’t lost on me.
The Hornet's cockpit is particularly vulnerable, so we've coated the polyglass with a flexible-quartz buffer. Still transparent, but much harder to shatter. Though I'm sure the enemy will try.
Compressed Gas in Crystal projectiles mean this upgrade will increase the turret's damage by a whopping 40%!
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 250 Confederate base.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 750 Syndicate base.
This upgrade will drastically thicken armor and add a wide-range electromagnetic pulse to weaponry. I'm suddenly very glad I'm not a Turret Control A.I.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 750 Confederate base.
The Specter's long range makes it work best behind tough units like a Rhino.
If you see a lot of guys standing around base, flicking lighters and cackling like maniacs, don't worry. It's part of their psych training.
Naturally-occurring uranium is rare on Cerulea IV, but the Ceruleans still used fusion technology. They were synthesizing it - and we can do the same.
After the Galactic Union dissolved, the Erazi went back to their old ways - attacking the bases that won't pay them. Soon, they'll look in our direction.
Defeat a Maar base of level #AMOUNT# or higher to free him.
Remember that alleged Specter combat shield development secret project that doesn't exist? It's allegedly nearly done. Blink twice if you want to fund it to completion.
There appears to be some sort of defensive virus in the second Specter file. I wonder if 12763517623176253761371 ERROR ERROR REBOOTING KIRA 2.63 SYSTEM
By eliminating failsafe mechanisms and emergency shutdown protocols, we've streamlined our production process, increasing uranium production as a result. No need to thank me, just doing my job.
Increase Uranium Production to 2,000 per hour.
We need more room to store all the loot you're stealing from other bases.
Successfully defend your base against an enemy attack.
As an invasion support A.I., I retain access to designs for many advanced vehicles. They could be further enhanced with Cerulean technology. First, we need a place to build them.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 150 Syndicate base.
Train 15 Marines and you’ll have a whole line of chiseled roughnecks to salute you.
Destroy command centers in Level 6 Syndicate bases.
We can't beat the Helio in a conventional war- they specialize in that. We have to pick our battles and hit their lightly defended camps.
Upgrade a Supply Depot to Level 8
Shorten Building, Research, or Training time by 4 days.
Increase Crystal Production to 1,500 per hour.
Fusion technology would have given us a huge advantage a few millennia ago. As it stands, we'lll need it just to keep a level playing field. You were simply born too late, Commander.
The more gas you need, the more gas you produce. There's an existential crisis here, and it's highly flammable.
Increase Crystal Production to 50,000 per hour.
Fastest way to refill those Silos is to defeat an enemy at least 5 levels above you.
Fly like a butterfly, sting like an armored assault-class Hornet.
Attack another player and destroy a building
We did worse than kill Malick - we embarrassed him. He's gathering troops at a new Maar base, hoping to destroy us and save face with the Confederate bureaucracy.
It's a harsh world, Commander. Show some poor noob the ropes… or the door.

Raiders collect twice as many resources as other units.

Select your TECH LAB.
Click RESEARCH.

Click RESEARCH.

Commander, I have given you a 15 minute speedup which can be applied here.
Build more Towers, and arrange them for maximum defensive power.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 250 Syndicate base.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 1500 Legion base.
Nothing disrupts the Maar government like destroying an Admin Base. The rank and file soldiers are helpless without leadership.
These vacuum-cooled osmium drills will enable us to extract even more crystals from Cerulea IV. They might even reduce workplace casualties by a percent or two.
The other renegades were once your allies. Don't let that stop you from bombing them into next week.
Upgrade a Supply Depot to Level 2
The Syndicate is turning a tidy profit by selling the adrenal glands of captured Marines. That's a new low, even for them. Time to teach these cretins a lesson.

Crystals are used as building materials.

Click BUILD.

If we add more Concussion Turrets to our base, enemies will look like they're standing still out there. That is, until they drop dead.
Our tech lab is close to replicating the tunneling nanomachine colonies that Ceruleans used to extract natural gas. They're insectoid -- you might say we've worked all the bugs out.

Rhino's are heavy-duty units that can take higher damage.

See what your troops have brought you.
Gives you 28 days of protection. Removed if you attack another player.
Build more Gas Refineries, and upgrade them.
All this radioactivity might save you the trouble of shaving... your other face.

The new upgrades in the Tech Lab are kind of a necessity at this point, as the researchers feel that they're not being treated as well as the soldiers -- or the automated turrets. They're currently circulating a petition asking that we stop calling them mad scientists, and start referring to them as scientific madmen. Anyhow... upgrade. Yes.
Loot over 1,000 energy from any faction's base
We're running out of room in the attic, so to speak. We need a new attic -- one covered in haze-forged obdurium plates.
Commander, have you ever seen a line of ten humans without an eyebrow between them? No? Do you want to?
Attack a player 10 levels below you

This is one of the most heavily-fortified Legion positions I've ever seen. If you can destroy Grod's Command Center, then you'll have cemented your reputation as one of the greatest military leaders in this galaxy.
Increase Energy Production to 700 per hour
The buzzing around base is that Hornets at their zenith are the bee’s knees.

Enhancing the Disruptor's osmium shell with reflexive armor plates will increase its damage capacity on the field. You'll also want to make sure you don't bump into one by accident, as the results will be messy.

*Kabam.com Exclusive Mission*

Hostilities are increasing all around, and some enemy commanders are beginning to question whether they're on the winning team. Occasionally, we'll get a small shipment from a nervous Captain, afraid his base will be the next one we flatten. We get something useful and, if he someday ends up in our custody, we go easy on 'em.
The original Helio Legion star system was destroyed when the sun went supernova. That's the last time they retreated from anything. Until today.
The turret is great so far, but this upgrade will improve its range, and we'll be picking off units long before they pose a threat to our resources.
With an advanced structure based on Cerulean technology, our Hornets will be able to take more hits and mount heavier weapons. Enemy turrets won't stand a chance.
The strength of our Titan frames is sufficient to install better engines. At the Staging Area, they're already arguing about who will get the first upgrade.
Loot over 1,000 gas from any faction's base
Loot over 5,000 uranium from any faction's base
Millions of years ago, the Z'ratari were brutal beasts that destroyed everything in their way. We will harness that history.
Before we roll out our new tech to the rest of the base, we first have to integrate Cerulium alloys into our command bunker, and Cerulium cores into our networks.

The Syndicate's preparing for an offensive against our base of operations, Commander. The best offense is to blast your opponent into subatomic particles and then salt the ground so that nothing ever grows there again.

Good news, Commander. The multilateral shafts have allowed us to multiply our gas production fourfold, and as a reward to the team for their hard work, they're all getting bendy straws for their daily quart of protein slurry.
Disruptors are brutally powerful, but that brutality -- like all that is good in life -- can always be amplified somehow.
You must do something with all that sunlight, and I’m not suggesting you treat yourself to a tan.
Attack a player 5 levels below you
Upgrade a Fusion Reactor to Level 9.
Destroy 10 turrets in a Confederate's base
Increase Uranium Production to 150,000 per hour.

Solar energy isn't as volatile as fusion, or as flammable as gas, or as destructive as crystal mining, but it still deserves some attention. We need more of that energy, even if it isn't as exciting (or lethal) as the others.
Hornets have been upgraded. Bear in mind that they're not the fastest units. They move at about the same speed as Rhinos, which makes for a devastating combination if you pair them up.

After careful consideration of the schematics, we realized that supply depots don't actually need evacuation shafts or fallout shelters. Removing them has allowed us to increase capacity significantly. You're welcome.
Upgrade a Fusion Reactor to Level 10.

During this upgrade, we'll be removing all illicit materials from under the soldiers' mattresses, and bolting foampads to their bunks. Admittedly, this might diminish morale, but it will make their sleeping quarters more secure.
With this upgrade, we'll be able to deliver a small army of soldiers and mechs. Our foes won't know what hit them.
The more gas you syphon, the more your enemies are left stranded in your dust.
Increase Uranium Production to 75,000 per hour.
Upgrade a Solar Plant to Level 8.

We've determined that the warping process can be sped up if we disable the consciousness inhibitors, leaving the troops awake through the entire warp process. Sure, it traumatizes them, but it's not like they've got futures anyhow.
This time, we just changed a lightbulb. Admittedly, it's a single Cerulean crystal the size of a Disruptor, lit by a sustained five-gigaton fissile reaction.
They do all the drilling, and you reap all the rewards. Remember to send a “thank you” note!
Increase Crystal Production to 6,000 per hour.
The final Specter upgrade file can't be decrypted. We can run it, but there's no telling what it will do. Hold on - I am backing myself up.
We're about to become a pirate's jackpot, Commander. With this technology, each of our Supply Depots will house enough resources to finance a war.
Think like a vampire – only suck up sunlight instead of getting BBQ'd.
Increase Uranium Production to 6,000 per hour
Upgrade Your Sniper Turret to level 11
I've pinpointed the location of General Grod's largest Gas Refining zone. Blasting their Command Centers will starve the Legion war machine.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 3 Erazi Syndicate base.
Build more Crystal Mines, and upgrade them.
We've salvaged Cerulean computers which surpass anything we've ever designed. Fifty septillian operations per second? I feel old.
You're not going to believe this, Commander, but an assault base commanded by one of Grod's sons just came down via orbital drop. Can you guess who they're after?
Crystals are vital to upgrading your base and defenses. The more you mine, the more you can build.
Revenge is a dish best served now! SCOUT first, then ATTACK. Select MARINES then click where you want them to warp in.
Increase Energy Production to 80,000 per hour.
To store more stuff, make more room.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 10 Syndicate base.
The gorgeous new cannon design allows the Disruptor to deal even more damage to an enemy that will be too badly burned to see the elegant beauty of it all.
Increase Uranium Production to 700 per hour
We can attack Maar bases while our city is building or researching. It's a great way to maintain our supply of crystal and gas resources.
In response to your question, Commander, this project focuses on new equipment and advanced training for *existing* soldiers. We won't need any "growth tubes."
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 750 Legion base.
Increase Gas Production to 75,000 per hour.
Fully upgrade your Shrikes and you’re a real winner. At everything.
