*Kabam.com Exclusive Mission*

Admiral Tenmu is in constant need of resources collected on Cerulea IV, but he knows that battles are raging on the surface just as they are in space. The Admiral tries to send useful supplies down to the surface whenever he can.
Every attack that leaves the Aurora-1 Colony should be prepared for any situation. Soldiers may fight the battle, but it's up to their Commander to equip them with the best technology.
Increase Gas Production to 6,000 per hour.
Destroy the Command Center of a player 5 levels above you
Loot over 1,000 crystals from any faction's base.
I don't know why we never thought to tie food rations to crystal production. Our miners are approaching their work with a truly inspiring level of determination.
Increasing the health of the Bomba Unit means decreasing the likelihood of an enemy victory. Spend the time to upgrade this beast and you'll notice the difference in no time.
Your resources will be well spent. This latest upgrade increases the turret's damage by another 50%!
Upgrade your turrets and towers to strengthen your base's defenses.
We're on the verge of a major breakthrough, Commander. One barrel of this hyper-efficient fuel will take a Shrike fifteen times around the Cerulean equator.
This is the heart of Executrix Scylith's operations. If we destroy the Command Center, we destroy much of her offensive capability in this sector.
Shorten Building, Research, Warp Gate or Training time by 5 minutes.
Bomba work best when they're able to regularly clear a path for your Marines and Specters. Train additional Bomba so there are plenty to go around when the time comes-- 50 should suffice.
We got lucky. Specter File 3 was programmed to open on the last day of the Cerulea IV invasion. The Maar expected that to be tomorrow. They always were overconfident.
Will it improve them? The long answer is that we’ll upgrade Marine pulse rifles to fire inert Cerulium. The short answer is ‘yes’.
Storing supplies in a secure location is such old-school thinking. How about a secure *dimension*? No? Okay, then what about counterkinetic projectile armor? Ah, now I have your attention.
I'm tired of working overtime, Commander. Developing a dedicated research assistant A.I. will help our tech lab work more efficiently and free me up to do what I do best -- help you.
Grod's files show he placed a beacon on Cerulea IV in case of defeat, to aim a "sore loser" orbital strike. Is he crazy enough to use it? It doesn't take an A.I. to answer that.
Commander, I've detected an outpost containing a large number of Maar elite military specialists. These are Maar "problem solvers", and your name is #1 on their problem list.
Tesla Towers are our most advanced defensive structures. They project fields of electrical energy, causing severe damage to multiple targets.
It may be time to invest in a more advanced Warp Gate. Your unit commanders are tired of my "Get out and walk!" joke, and it's the only one I have in my databanks.
Increase Crystal Production to 12,000 per hour.
Increase Energy Production to 12,000 per hour.
Check in with Kira on July 4th (PDT)
Legion soldiers love victory parades, even when they haven't won yet. Let's put a dent in their morale by destroying their parade grounds. Defeat a Helio base of level #AMOUNT# or higher.
I am indexing war crimes committed by the Helio Legion. It would be faster to index ones they haven't committed. To avoid being their next victim, we have to strike quickly.
Fully optimized Specters are otherworldly and unparalleled in their long-distance range.
Shorten Building, Research, Warp Gate or Training time by 15 minutes.
Combat A.I.s are great at coming up with perfect firing angles. The better the turret, the more angles they can choose from.
Loot over 5,000 uranium from any faction's base
Attack a player who has attacked your base
Trust your A.I. on this - from now on, when you wake up smelling burnt flesh and ozone, it will be good news.
To prepare, have units in your Staging Area. Use the Map, select Syndicate Level 1, Scout that base, then Attack!
A Pulse Tank is too much machine for most non-A.I. brains to handle. Providing each operator a dedicated satellite uplink will boost combat performance across the board.
Increase Crystal production by +300% for 7 days.
The only thing more gung-ho than a Marine is a Marine piloting an armored Titan mech.
Upgrade a Gun Turret to Level 2

The more streamlined Shrike design required us to remove ejection-seat capabilities and distress signals for the pilots. Personally, I think this just creates an incentive for them to do a better job.
I could bore you with all of the advances we are making in xenobiology and selective breeding, but I know you just want these Lancers to shoot more acid. Yes, they’ll do that.
Upgrade an X-1 Cannon to level 3
Commander, one of our researchers has found a way to more effectively have our Raiders deliver their nano-machine munitions using spent Disrupter shells. See? We're going green.
Upgrade a Solar Plant to Level 10.
As long as you keep building weapons, you need to keep enriching uranium.
We can't build our Supply Depots much higher or much wider without making them easy targets. That only leaves one direction for us to go.
The Maar did more work on the Specter project than we ever suspected. I'd let you read this, Commander, but then I'd have to direct the security drones to kill you.
Upgrade Your Sniper Turret to level 6
The Aurora-1 Colony seems peaceful for the moment, but we both know that can change. Better upgrade your Colony Warp Gate to be on the safe side.
Our double agents -- well, I assume they're ours, and not the enemy's, because that would make them triple agents -- wait, what was the question? Look, let's just attack the Confederacy.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 20 Confederate base.
Increase Uranium Production to 12,000 per hour.
The Maar put a great deal of effort into capturing, training and equipping these beasts. We have every reason to keep up with them.
The return on another upgrade is an easy 10% increase in damage, and at level 7 we can boost the range!
It's time to increase storage capacity once more. Currently, our supplies are jammed in there pretty tight. If a depot gets hit, we're in for some gorgeous fireworks.
Attack a Level 3 Helio Legion base
Make sure your Silos are upgraded. You will be getting a lot of resources...
Half the upgrade cost is for the improved shockwave technology. The other half is to reinforce our own base around the turret.
General Grod of the Helio Legion sabotaged the Galactic Union to provoke the war his people wanted. It'd be a shame to disappoint him.
Increase Gas Production to 6,000 per hour.
Arm Raiders for your cause, and they'll put their sticky fingers to work for you.
Upgrade a Gas Refinery to Level 10.
I don't know what's more dangerous for our soldiers - attacking an Erazi spaceport, or taking leave at one. You humans should use anti-virus programs.
The sun can't stop giving away energy. Soak up as much as you can!
We won't get further by improving the armor of the Z'ratari. Time to start modifying their bones and organs.
The new upgrade means that these Lancer will be faster, more violent, and harder to kill. What could possibly go wrong?
The ultimate gravity tech for Raider weapons. This is one black hole we shouldn't be afraid to throw money into.
We must stay ahead of the pack. Keep improving your Bomba units before you get pushed off the map.
More lethal and sleek than ever before, the ultimate Shrike will soon be yours to command.
Z'ratari Rhinos are similar in body and mind - slow. Better jetpacks will speed their bodies. We can't do anything for their minds.
Successfully defend your base against an enemy attack.
We've reinforced the exterior with a dilatant liquid armor, which hardens on impact. It's also cherry-flavoreds, so we'll have to remind the soldiers not to eat it. In retrospect, not a great idea.
Your units are stronger, and your tactics are more advanced.
What's that on your forehead? Oh, I see... but not as well as you. My, what a great place for a third eye!

It's been discovered that by manipulating ore at the sub-atomic level, we can drastically boost our production of weapons-grade depleted uranium. I'm rather embarrassed I didn't think of this sooner. My face would be red, if that were one of my UI options.
Increase Crystal Production to 50,000 per hour.

The factory workers enjoy listening to synthetic pulse-metal as they work. Personally, I don't enjoy that genre of music, but I've discovered that if we speed up the BPM, we can make them work faster. But that music is really heavy stuff, and if we speed it up too fast, we risk coronary thrombosis. There's a sweet spot, Commander.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 2000 Confederate base.
Commander, have you ever seen a line of ten humans without a single eyebrow between them? No? Do you want to?

*Kabam.com Exclusive Mission*

Our scouting patrols have been known to intercept cargo shipments from time to time from enemy factions or pirates. It looks like they've brought something back from their latest encounter.
Commander, we have received word that the Erazi have found Cerulean artifact of scientific importance. Let's destroy their base, and recover it for ourselves!
The more Specters, the more damage you'll do before your troops are within enemy range.
Crystals are used for building, upgrading, and training.
The X-1 Cannon is a powerful defender. It shoots explosive shells which damage all nearby enemy units.
With 10 Titans hanging around, only a bonehead would start trouble in this neighborhood.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 100 Legion base.
Our tech lab is close to replicating the nanomachine colonies that Ceruleans used for Gas extraction. They're insectoid - you might say we’ve worked all the bugs out.
Use your Barracks to train a squad of Rhinos.
Rhinos are already hardened soldiers. The more you train them, the more devastation they deal.
In order to more effectively obtain resources, we've used some of our Scarbide material to improve the jet packs on our Raiders. That should help them get in there and get us those resources!

Pulse Tank upgrades are nearly finished. This devastating engine can take (and deliver) a great deal of punishment, which means that it can be used to single-handedly destroy the poorly-defended bases of novice Commanders. Just a thought.
I've found ten applicants with no recorded past. They are also willing to forego a future.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 40 Legion base.
I was programmed NOT to kill things or destroy property. I guess I was the only one.
Brand new metal plating for the Colony Warp Gate has just arrived. The sooner we apply this upgrade, the sooner we can start deploying bigger and better attacks.
Build a squad of Raiders, then reap additional rewards for using them in battle!
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 25 Confederate base.
Your Command Center is your castle. In lieu of a moat, I took the liberty of installing spent-rubidium phase-shields and counterkinetic barricades. Hope you approve, Commander.
Upgrade a Gas Refinery to Level 9.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 15 Confederate base.
Defeat any player's base of level #AMOUNT# or higher.

The scientists in the Tech Lab are currently experimenting with bacteria-augmented methane recycling, and they've installed some kind of new food processing unit in their kitchen. Look, all I know is, I'm really glad I don't eat. And I guess this qualifies as an upgrade.
Upgrade Your Sniper Turret to level 4
Increase Energy Production to 3000 per hour.
Upgrade a Tesla Tower to Level 7
Upgrade a Crystal Mine to Level 7.
Cerulean vehicle armor bursts outward to lessen weapon impacts, then forms new layers. With an edge like that, our Titans will be unstoppable.
Build more Reactors, and upgrade them.
Marines love going into battle behind a Rhino squad - less visibility but longer life span.

Commander, we have intercepted one of Scyllith?s top secret files. This could be the secrets to Erazi Specter?s efficiency in battle, or one of Scyllith?s ?home movies?. We should preview the file before we show it to the troops.
Increase Gas Production to 12,000 per hour.

The new targeting protocol for Shrike weaponry is a rudimentary A.I. that zeroes in on moving targets and neutralizes them. When you see a Shrike, I advise you to remain motionless until it has passed.
We got lucky. Specter File 3 was programmed to open on the last day of the Cerulea IV invasion. The Maar expected that to be tomorrow. They always were overconfident.

This upgrade is a little complicated. How do I explain it to a carbon-based primate? Okay, I think I have it: imagine a tesseract, cubed and grafted into a wormhole's refractory wave. That's an oversimplification, but you get the idea.
Crime lords of the Erazi Syndicate are meeting here on Cerulea IV. Executrix Scylith is among them. Time to do the galaxy a big favor.
Loot over 5,000 energy from any faction's base
A good A.I. can spot "abandoned" bases that are actually Syndicate hideouts. Let's show them that they can't fool us.
Revenge is a dish best served a.s.a.p.
Adrenaline boosts will make our Rhinos even angrier. The med staff know not to make sudden moves near them.
Destroy 3 defensive towers in an attack
After five design reviews, we've finally managed to incorporate Cerulean structure and weapons advantages without making each tank look like a big, ugly beetle.
Upgrade a Fusion Reactor to Level 8.
Increase Gas Production to 3,000 per hour.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 100 Syndicate base.
Build more Solar Plants, and upgrade them.
Pyros were originally equipped by the Galactic Union to burn through the beetle carapaces of Cerulean infantry. They'll be great at torching enemy structures.
The Erazi are manufacturing weapons on Cerulea IV and selling them off-world. Destroying their base will save lives - and get their materials.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 15 Legion base.

Raiders collect twice as many resources as other units.

Select your TECH LAB.
Click RESEARCH.
Select the RAIDER.
Click RESEARCH.

Commander, I have given you a 15 minute speedup which can be applied here.
Upgrade a Gun Turret to Level 7
This new enhancement for our Hornets will add tougher armor, more powerful cannons, and integrated A.I. combat assistance.
Build another Crystal Mine, or upgrade your existing one.

The upgrade was complicated by the fact that many of our troops were inside the old building while it was being demolished. Little miscommunication there. But everyone's fine. Well, you and I are fine. That's what matters.
Increase Crystal Production to 6,000 per hour
The changes to your Command Center will make us the envy of all the other bases, Commander. They'll feel a surge of envy just before they see a surge of lethal energy.
If the Lancer ever figure out how to get free of those collars, we're in deep trouble. But just to make that eventuality more interesting, we've augmented their armor and weaponry.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 1000 Legion base.
Destroy the command center of a level 350 Maar base
Pyros are the most powerful attackers in the game.
Increase Energy production by +300% for 7 days.
Our Marines joke that Maar soldiers can't use the bathroom without explicit orders. Let's take down their Command Center and make sure those orders never come.
You're almost at peak crystal production. Don't slow down now!
Other players are great sources of resources.
Upgrade a Solar Plant to Level 8.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 350 Syndicate base.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 2000 Syndicate base.

Adding to the thickness of the hull would only add to the Shrike's dimensions, slowing it down, but our techs have figured out how to compress leaves of tritanium into interlocking sheets that are both durable and lightweight.
Shorten Building, Research, Warp Gate or Training time by 2 and a half hours.
More missions, better rewards on Kabam.com!
Loot over 1,000 uranium from any faction's base
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 100 Confederate base.
Use the MAP to locate a Maar Confederacy base, then SCOUT to ensure you have enough troops to take them out.
Increasing the damage output is a given, but this upgrade will also extend the turret's range, increasing the chance that enemy units will be obliterated before getting close enough to pose a threat.
The Tech Lab researches new combat units.
The scientists have devised a new large-scale crystal extraction process that will change everything. In just 100 years, we'll be able to hollow out Cerulea IV and live inside it.
My translation data shows the phrase "lightning never strikes the same place twice" is shared galaxy-wide. Also, its completely untrue.
On this world, the golden rule means showing no mercy. That's all your enemies will show you.
Part of a key operation, but lost your helmet? Every grunt knows that sinking feeling. I've always said that putting combat prep in the hands of machines is the way to go.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 350 Legion base.
Upgrade a Supply Depot to Level 7

A fighter until the very end, the Bomba will explode once they are defeated-- giving other Units a unique advantage against the enemy. I suggest training a Bomba as soon as possible so we may see this powerful new beast for ourselves.
Let's keep improving our shockwave turret damage. Their primary function is to slow enemies, but "killing" and "slowing" can overlap.
We could use more AIs around here. Build a Factory, and I'll show you how to make more friends.
Loot over 1,000 energy from any faction's base

"I'm sure you're anxious to hear about our latest round of ridiculous technological advances to improve our Warp Gates. Well, we made it bigger. Yep, that's it. That said, it's surprisingly effective.
One Shrike is dangerous, but 10 of them can cut through enemy defenses like a hot knife through cartilage.
Upgrade a Gas Refinery to Level 8.
The Legion's stockpiled a massive payload of Cerulean ordnance in preparation for a new incursion. We've got to strike first, Commander.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 25 Legion base.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 150 Confederate base.

Rhino's are heavy-duty units that can take higher damage.

Select your TECH LAB.
Click RESEARCH.
Select the RHINO.
Click RESEARCH.
Tens of thousands of Lancers have migrated into the Cerulean system on the solar winds. They're dangerous, but the species has enormous potential as a weapon of war.
I've found ten applicants with no recorded past. They are also willing to forego a future.
The changes to your Command Center will make us the envy of all the other bases, Commander. They'll feel a surge of envy just before they see a surge of lethal energy.
A Maar scientist tried defect to our side, but he was detained at a Maar base. Before I disabled my ethics subroutines, I thought that leaving him to be tortured was not correct.
Our scientists have improved the Bomba's attack harnesses. We should get the rest of them equipped quickly.
Shorten Building, Research, or Training time by 2 and a half days.
Fusion technology would have given us a huge advantage a few millennia ago. As it stands, we'lll need it just to keep a level playing field. You were simply born too late, Commander.
Increase Uranium Production to 6,000 per hour.
There are a lot of other renegades leveling up behind you. Strike now before they overtake you!
Take out an enemy's defenses and the rest of their base is a cakewalk.
Your enemies hardly look like environmentalists, so who are they kidding with those solar panels?
The Erazi Syndicate used Raider units against colonies that refused to pay protection money. We can copy their military tactics, you can choose if we leave the extortion out.
Commander, the Maar have uncovered a Cerulean artifact which could boost our construction tremendously. Let's seize it!

By burning depleted uranium with some of the energy from the inital reaction, we can improve efficiency. This will let us draw more energy from the uranium ore that we've gathered. I expect a hefty holiday bonus, Commander.
Destroy the command center in the level 6 Confederate's base
Increase Gas production by +300% for 7 days.
Increase Crystal Production to 700 per hour
Loot over 5,000 energy from any faction's base
Increase Crystal Production to 2,000 per hour.

A fusion reaction can be powered-up exponentially with the aid of a matter-antimatter reaction. Upgrade the reactor and I'll have the lab show you what I mean. From a safe distance, of course. Like maybe from orbit.
Increase Uranium Production to 150,000 per hour.
Increase Energy Production to 75,000 per hour.

Admiral Tenmu is hoping you can support him by giving him #AMOUNT# Uranium.
TIP: This is a one-time donation and the mission is only claimable if you have banked enough Uranium.
Upgrade a Tesla Tower to Level 4
Increase Crystal Production to 1,500 per hour.
Upgrade a Concussion Turret to Level 7
This is the largest Helio base on Cerulea IV. General Grod is polishing his medals somewhere inside, and he'll never let us take him alive. We're fine with that, right?
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 40 Syndicate base.
The best thing about improving Pyros is getting a new set of safety standards to ignore. Just when you thought plasma couldn't get any hotter...
The Warp Gate connects the Aurora-1 Colony to the rest of the galaxy. Make sure you're checking for additional structure upgrades on a regular basis.
Helios shows no mercy to anyone. Give them a taste of their own brand of diplomacy.
That's going to leave a mark... of shame!
It's been an amazing two years, please enjoy this gift!
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 50 Syndicate base.
The troops are packed into the staging area like explosive malthusium rounds in a carbon-seeking incendiary launcher. They're high-precision killing machines, and they await your orders, Commander.
Gives you 24 hours of protection. Removed if you attack another player.
Our senior researcher just told me that [BUILD OBJECT X]s are the secret to folding time and space "as if they were beach towels." Sounds like she's looking forward to a vacation.
Increase Gas Production to 24,000 per hour.
Build more Reactors, and upgrade them.
All day every day, the sun gives away energy – free energy! Don't let it all go to waste.
Increase Gas Production to 80,000 per hour.
Dish out more than 10,000 points of damage in an attack
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 50 Legion base.
Commander, our Titans have been upgraded with auxiliary thrusters and rotating stabilizers for enhanced maneuverability. We could have just made the suits more flexible, but that seemed too...easy.
6x the speed of all Training for 1 hour.
This improvement to our energy transfer technology yields a more powerful Pulse Tank transformation. The operators are calling it "Beast Mode". I wish *I* had a "Beast Mode."

We can increase our supply capacity by replacing the anti-radiation shielding with crystal lattice structures, effectively storing uranium and crystals in the same location. Don't ask about the side-effects.
The Maar Confederacy is gearing up for an all-out assault on our Command Center. It's kill or be killed, and I usually favor the former.
Cerulium walls are ultra-dense and near-impenetrable. Our troops will not only survive the impact of Disruptor fire, they'll sleep through it.

The new Staging Area features a cryostasis chamber where soldiers are frozen in blocks and thawed out upon deployment. We had a little difficulty calibrating the temperature during the reheating process, but everything's better now.
The more turrets you build, the better you can defend your base.

We mistakenly added hallucinogens to the tech researchers' protein slurry -- oops! -- and during the ensuing throes of madness, they developed a number of new technologies that will help us win this war.
Hornets were named after stinging insects from Earth. They traveled in groups called swarms. Commander, your forces will be much better off if reinforced with a swarm of these Hornets.
Solar Plants convert solar radiation into Energy used for research and training units.
Build more Solar Plants, and upgrade them.

It probably sounds counterintuitive to detonate nukes under the crust in order to force more uranium ore to the surface, but we're running low on time. This is our safest bet. Well, not our safest -- it's our best bet.

Click the Combat icon at the bottom of the screen.
Select FACTIONS.
SCOUT a Level 3 ERAZI base.
ATTACK the base.

I'd recommend sending in 2 Rhinos with some Raiders or Marines, Commander.
With no living Ceruleans around to interrogate, only the secrets of the Salvage Box can help us unlock the highest combat control functions of a Control Device.
It seems that we can use this Scarbide material to create new Rifles for our Marines. While normal firearms work by firing ballistic matter at a target, these shoot antimatter! Isn't that clever?
Factories build and train mechanized units.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 1500 Syndicate base.
Reinforcing structures will help them stand up to enemy attacks, but if you build a Sniper Turret, it can take out injured enemy units before they get close enough to pose a threat at all.
The only way to defend against next-generation Disruptor designs is to have that same technology. Anything less, and you're one more obituary file.
For that sad excuse for an enemy, the apocalypse came early this year!
10x the speed of all Training for 1 hour.
Commander, we should collect more resources. We will need them, soon.
Naturally-occuring uranium is rare on Cerulea IV, but the Ceruleans still utilized fusion technology. Turns out they were synthesizing it -- and we could learn to do the same.
Build another Gas Refinery, or upgrade your existing one.
Cerulean propulsion systems used gravity fields to hover totally still for accurate attacks, and accelerate quickly to avoid return fire. Perfect for our Shrikes.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 1500 Confederate base.
Our Tech Lab scientists are constantly discovering ways to improve Gun Turret range. With the right upgrades, we'll destroy enemy troops before they can even see us.
By rerouting all power through a single "artery" down the Shrike's core, we've been able to produce a substantial increase in efficiency and performance.
Loot over 1,000 uranium from any faction's base

Time for the Disruptors to truly live up to their names. These upgraded monstrosities will work extremely well when paired with Shrikes, because the Disruptors can absorb a great deal of damage -- and then inflict it.
Dish out more than 100,000 points of damage in an attack
To store more stuff, make more room.

You will doubtless recall the memorandum I prepared regarding the plans for a new Shrike design, including an extended fuselage. They were the subject of many off-color jokes in the barracks. At any rate, the upgrades are ready. Let us not speak of this again.
Increase Crystal Production to 150,000 per hour.

The streamlining process has identified several superfluous mechanisms, like safety protocols, that we can eliminate during this upgrade. Incidentally, a little-known fact about workers with prosthetic limbs: they're very careful, which makes them more efficient.
It’s not just the factions. Countless renegades splintered from the Union as well. Be prepared!
Commander, Cerulea IV has sufficient natural gas reserves to fuel our war effort for the next 2,000,000 years. I'll be around then, because I'm an AI. You, however, will need to hurry.
Our scientists have invented a new tank, which powers up in battle. We can easily research it.
Dish out more than 10,000 points of damage in an attack against another player
Shorten Building, Research, or Training time by 24 hours.

I have incoming reports of a new base available for colonization. The Aurora-1 Colony is brimming with resources and undiscovered technology -- sounds like a suitable outpost for your second base, Commander.
Time to upgrade our factory if we're going to compete with the other factions, Commander. At this rate, they're more productive than we are, and that's just not acceptable.
Destroy the Command Center in a Level 50 Confederate base.
The Erazi love to steal information. They even tried to copy my source code and sell me! Blowing up this base is the best way to insure our own network security.

Upgrading the Command Center unlocks brand new buildings, and space for more buildings.

Select the COMMAND CENTER.
Click UPGRADE.
Click UPGRADE again.
No matter how many Erazi we defeat, they'll crawl back into Cerulean affairs as long as their networks are active. We need to destroy their infrastructure on this planet.
Before retreating, Grod's son tried to make contact with an elite Helio unit guarding a hidden Cerulean computer core. It must hold secrets- and I think we're both the curious type.

By deploying magnetic warheads, we've opened up a new coronal hole in the sun. The ensuing solar windstorm has amplified our energy output. But we've also halved our life expectancies. Well, yours, anyhow. I'm ageless.
The Maar Confederacy has a network of special operatives. They even the told us how to train them! Well, not really "told". I stole the documents from their servers.
Increase Energy Production to 6,000 per hour

I just wanted to explain this morning's explosion. It turns out that a few of our Pyros got excited when they heard about the new upgrades, and in their glee, they detonated a few kilograms of red phosphorus, incinerating a few civilians in the process. So, in other words, nothing unusual.
The Shrike is fast, tough, and dishes out lots of damage.
Time to increase the output of our crystal mines if we're going to outlive our enemies. Push harder!
This turret has performed well, but it is certainly capable of picking off targets faster. This upgrade will increase the turret's damage by a whopping 50%!
Considering the Warp gate was originally a Union replica of Cerulean technology, the irony of augmenting it with a Cerulean Core is not lost on me.
The improvements to our Staging Area will make it possible to prepare a larger number of troops for combat. The enemy will be overrun in short order, Commander.
Don't let your guard down, Commander. Show your enemies you're a force to be reckoned with.
We must improve efficiency in our solar collection systems and increase energy production.
Increase Energy production by +300% for 24 hours.
